DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Mass Thyroid Carcinoma Histologic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of tissue in which a carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland originated.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/14/20 jk Upd RD to "Qualified"; CPTAC released AI. 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) for PRAD Baseline CRF. 7/26/19 jk Updated OC term to Tumor Mass; used on multiple CPTAC CRFs.  6/26/19 jk created for CPTAC Baseline CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and undifferentiated (anaplastic) carcinoma._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A usually benign neoplasm composed of large cells with abundant eosinophilic granular cytoplasm.  Representative examples include oncocytic neoplasms of the thyroid gland, and kidney. (NCI05)

Concepts.definition: A usually benign neoplasm composed of large cells with abundant eosinophilic granular cytoplasm.  Representative examples include oncocytic neoplasms of the thyroid gland, and kidney. (NCI05)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Clear Cell Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Clear Cell Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the predominance of malignant follicular clear cells.  These cells have the nuclear features that characterize the papillary carcinomas of the thyroid gland.

Concepts.longName: Clear Cell Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: A morphologic variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the predominance of malignant follicular clear cells.  These cells have the nuclear features that characterize the papillary carcinomas of the thyroid gland.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An encapsulated or nonencapsulated variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the predominance of follicular structures. The malignant follicular cells display the nuclear features that characterize the papillary adenocarcinomas of the thyroid gland.: An encapsulated or nonencapsulated variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the predominance of follicular structures. The malignant follicular cells display the nuclear features that characterize the papillary adenocarcinomas of the thyroid gland.

Concepts.longName: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: An encapsulated or nonencapsulated variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the predominance of follicular structures. The malignant follicular cells display the nuclear features that characterize the papillary adenocarcinomas of the thyroid gland.

Concepts.longName: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: An encapsulated or nonencapsulated variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the predominance of follicular structures. The malignant follicular cells display the nuclear features that characterize the papillary adenocarcinomas of the thyroid gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An area of the thyroid gland not otherwise specified.

Concepts.definition: An area of the thyroid gland not otherwise specified.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A selected option that indicated an other histologic type.

Concepts.definition: A selected option that indicated an other histologic type.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Abnormalities that occur in human cells and tissues and models of human cancer.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Thyroid Gland Carcinoma Histologic Type Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and undifferentiated (anaplastic) carcinoma.:Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the thyroid gland. It includes the following main subtypes: follicular, papillary, medullary, poorly differentiated, and anaplastic carcinoma.
Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
